title: EnglishPod 初级 英文播客 0167

segments.en: Hello, everyone, and welcome to EnglishPod.
And today we're going on a little driving lesson.
segments.cn: 今天我们要进行一次小的驾驶课程。

segments.en: That's right, we're going to learn how to drive.
segments.cn: 没错，我们要学习如何驾驶。

segments.en: But not only how to drive, but all the vocabulary and words associated to this activity.
segments.cn: 不仅仅是如何驾驶，还有与此活动相关的所有词汇和单词。

segments.en: So, why don't we listen to this dialogue for the first time and we'll be back to explain it.
segments.cn: 那么，为什么我们不先听一下这个对话，然后再回来解释呢？

segments.en: Okay, I'm ready for my driving lesson.
segments.cn: 好的，我准备好我的驾驶课程了。

segments.en: First, let's go over things one more time.
segments.cn: 首先，让我们再复习一遍。

segments.en: Now, before you even think of starting the car, make sure your seat is at a comfortable position and you can grip the steering wheel firmly.
segments.cn: 现在，在你考虑启动汽车之前，确保你的座椅处于舒适的位置，并且你能牢牢握住方向盘。

segments.en: Next, check your rear-view mirrors to make sure you can see properly.
segments.cn: 接下来，检查你的后视镜，确保你能看清楚。

segments.en: We've been through this a million times.
segments.cn: 我们已经讲过一百万次了。

segments.en: Okay, now gently step on the clutch and shift to first gear.
segments.cn: 好的，现在轻轻踩下离合器，换到一档。

segments.en: Now, accelerate gently and let go of the clutch as you do it.
segments.cn: 现在，轻轻加速，同时放开离合器。

segments.en: Keep your eyes on the road.
We are coming up to a red light.
Oh, this is just like playing video games.
segments.cn: 哦，这就像玩电子游戏一样。

segments.en: So it's a great driving lesson just like the video games.
segments.cn: 所以这是一堂像电子游戏一样的精彩驾驶课程。

segments.en: Exactly, well, hopefully not like video games.
segments.cn: 没错，希望不是像电子游戏那样。

segments.en: We don't want to hurt anyone.
But that comes a little bit later.
First, let's check out some of these very important phrases in today's language takeaway.
segments.cn: 首先，让我们看看今天语言学习中的一些非常重要的短语。

segments.en: Alright, so in language takeaway we have five words for you today.
segments.cn: 好吧，在语言学习中我们今天有五个单词。

segments.en: Starting with the first one, the steering wheel.
So this comes from the fact that we have a wheel that we use to turn the car left and right.
segments.cn: 这源于我们有一个轮子，用来左右转动汽车。

segments.en: And so that's called to steer, to change the direction of something.
segments.cn: 所以这叫做转向，改变某物的方向。

segments.en: So the verb to steer is to take it left or right.
segments.cn: 所以动词转向是指向左或右。

segments.en: Exactly, so steering wheel is the instrument that we use to change the car's direction.
segments.cn: 没错，方向盘是我们用来改变汽车方向的工具。

segments.en: And well, apart from this instrument, also in order to look to other cars that are behind you, you would look at your rear view mirror.
segments.cn: 除了这个工具，想要查看后面的汽车，你需要看后视镜。

segments.en: This is a mirror that you have in front of you in the middle of the car.
segments.cn: 这是你在车中间前方的一个镜子。

segments.en: And you look at this mirror to find out if there are cars behind you.
segments.cn: 你看这个镜子是为了查看后面是否有车。

segments.en: That means you're looking at the back.

segments.cn: 后面意味着后方或背后。

segments.en: What about the mirrors that are on the side of the car, on the doors?
segments.cn: 那么车门旁边的镜子呢？

segments.en: Those are called side view mirrors.
And well, moving on, he was instructing her on how to drive and he said, step on the clutch.
segments.cn: 继续，他在教她如何驾驶，并说，踩下离合器。

segments.en: Well, this is an important word for those of you who are driving manual cars.
segments.cn: 这是一个对那些驾驶手动汽车的人来说很重要的词。

segments.en: That means that you have to control the way that the gas goes into the engine by yourself.
segments.cn: 这意味着你必须自己控制油门进入发动机的方式。

segments.en: And so a clutch is a pedal.
segments.cn: 所以离合器是一个踏板。

segments.en: It's the third pedal on the left and you push this pedal to change gears.
segments.cn: 它是左边的第三个踏板，你踩下这个踏板来换挡。

segments.en: Okay, so some cars they don't have this.
For those of you who don't, don't worry about it.
segments.cn: 对于那些没有的人，不用担心。

segments.en: But if you do, a clutch is on the far left.
segments.cn: 但如果有，离合器在最左边。

segments.en: Okay, so this is for a manual car, manual transmission car because many people have automatics where you just accelerate and the car automatically changes gears.
segments.cn: 好的，这适用于手动汽车，因为许多人驾驶自动汽车，只需加速，汽车会自动换挡。

segments.en: Exactly, and so a lot of Europeans drive manual cars and have this clutch.
segments.cn: 没错，很多欧洲人驾驶手动汽车并有这个离合器。

segments.en: Okay, so you step on the clutch and in order to change gear you say to shift into first gear.
segments.cn: 好的，所以你踩下离合器，然后为了换挡，你说换到一档。

segments.en: That's right, because if you're driving you know that you can't go from first to fifth gear, right?
segments.cn: 没错，因为如果你在驾驶，你知道你不能从一档直接换到五档，对吧？

segments.en: There's four or five gears and so you have to go one, two, three, four, five.
segments.cn: 有四个或五个档位，所以你必须依次换挡。

segments.en: You have to go in order.
So we're shifting, we're moving up or we're moving down.
segments.cn: 所以我们在换挡，我们在向上或向下移动。

segments.en: And now in the dialogue we heard to shift into first gear.
segments.cn: 在对话中我们听到换到一档。

segments.en: Exactly, and so normally the car starts in N, neutral.
segments.cn: 没错，通常汽车从N档（空档）开始。

segments.en: That was when you're at a brake, you're at a stop.
segments.cn: 那是在你刹车时，你停下来的时候。

segments.en: And if you want to start the car you have to shift to first gear and that's the lowest that's gonna help the car go.
segments.cn: 如果你想启动汽车，你必须换到一档，这是最低的档位，可以帮助汽车起步。

segments.en: Okay, so to shift into first gear.
I think this is really useful especially because it's very specific so you don't really see it very often in anywhere but sometimes you need to use it.
segments.cn: 我认为这非常有用，特别是因为它非常具体，所以你在其他地方不常见，但有时你需要使用它。

segments.en: That's right and it's especially useful if you're trying to teach someone how to drive.
segments.cn: 没错，尤其是在你试图教别人如何驾驶时特别有用。

segments.en: Yeah, because not everyone knows how to drive manual.
segments.cn: 是的，因为并不是每个人都知道如何驾驶手动汽车。

segments.en: So why don't we listen to the dialogue again and we'll be back to explain Fluency Builder.
segments.cn: 那么我们再听一遍对话，然后再回来解释流利度提升。

segments.en: Okay, I'm ready for my driving lesson.
segments.cn: 好的，我准备好我的驾驶课程了。

segments.en: First let's go over things one more time.
segments.cn: 首先让我们再复习一遍。

segments.en: Now before you even think of starting the car, make sure your seat is at a comfortable position and you can grip the steering wheel firmly.
segments.cn: 现在在你考虑启动汽车之前，确保你的座椅处于舒适的位置，并且你能牢牢握住方向盘。

segments.en: Next, check your rear view mirrors to make sure you can see properly.
segments.cn: 接下来，检查你的后视镜，确保你能看清楚。

segments.en: We've been through this a million times.
segments.cn: 我们已经讨论过一百万次了。

segments.en: Okay, now gently step on the clutch and shift to first gear.
segments.cn: 好的，现在轻轻踩下离合器，换到一档。

segments.en: Now accelerate gently and let go of the clutch as you do it.
segments.cn: 现在轻轻加速，同时放开离合器。

segments.en: Keep your eyes on the road.
We are coming up to a red light.
Oh, this is just like playing video games.
segments.cn: 哦，这就像玩电子游戏一样。

segments.en: So now why don't we take a look at four key phrases in Fluency Builder.
segments.cn: 现在我们来看看流利构建器中的四个关键短语。

segments.en: Well, the first phrase is maybe the most important when driving.
segments.cn: 好吧，第一个短语可能是开车时最重要的。

segments.en: It's the first thing you do.
All right, so you don't say you turn on the car, right?
segments.cn: 好吧，所以你不说你打开汽车，对吧？

segments.en: No, so you put the key in the ignition and you start the car.
segments.cn: 不，你把钥匙插入点火器，然后启动汽车。

segments.en: That means you, you know, you turn it on.
segments.cn: 这意味着你知道，你把它打开。

segments.en: What about when you want to turn off the car?
segments.cn: 那么当你想关掉汽车时呢？

segments.en: Our next phrase is a million times.
segments.cn: 我们下一个短语是一百万次。

segments.en: Why is this a phrase a million times?
segments.cn: 为什么这个短语是一百万次？

segments.en: We've been through this a million times.
segments.cn: 我们已经讨论过一百万次了。

segments.en: Otherwise, I think I might kill the person because a million times means that we've had this same conversation many, many, many times, but you can't actually have it a million times.
segments.cn: 否则，我想我可能会杀了那个人，因为一百万次意味着我们已经进行了很多很多次同样的对话，但你实际上不可能进行一百万次。

segments.en: Yeah, it's a way to say a lot.
segments.cn: 是的，这是一种说很多的方式。

segments.en: So I've heard him say this a million times.
segments.cn: 所以我听他说过这一百万次。

segments.en: I've heard this story a million times.
segments.cn: 我听过这个故事一百万次。

segments.en: I've turned the car on a million times.
segments.cn: 我启动过汽车一百万次。

segments.en: And now, well, they were driving and they heard a police siren and the guy told her to pull over.
segments.cn: 现在，他们在开车时听到警笛，那个家伙告诉她靠边停车。

segments.en: Okay, so this is a very common car phrase again, especially when you're dealing with the police.
segments.cn: 好吧，这又是一个非常常见的汽车短语，尤其是当你和警察打交道时。

segments.en: So to pull over means to slow the car down and to stop it on the side of the road.
segments.cn: 所以靠边停车意味着减慢汽车速度并在路边停车。

segments.en: So you could hear a policeman say pull over.
segments.cn: 所以你可以听到警察说靠边停车。

segments.en: That means slow down and stop the car on the side because obviously you can't stop in the middle of the road.
segments.cn: 这意味着减速并在路边停车，因为显然你不能在路中间停车。

segments.en: So sometimes your mobile phone will ring as well and you don't have a hands-free so you have to pull over to the side so you can pick up the phone usually, right?
segments.cn: 所以有时你的手机也会响，而你没有免提，所以你必须靠边停车，以便你可以接电话，通常，对吧？

segments.en: Or you could say, hey, mom, could you pull over?
segments.cn: 或者你可以说，嘿，妈妈，你能靠边停车吗？

segments.en: I have to use the restroom.
And our last phrase for today is to take me alive.
segments.cn: 我们今天最后一个短语是活抓我。

segments.en: And so this is a phrase that we use when we're talking about people who are running away from the law.
segments.cn: 所以这是我们在谈论逃避法律的人时使用的短语。

segments.en: So there he says, they'll never capture me.
segments.cn: 所以他说，他们永远不会抓住我。

segments.en: And if they do, I'll be dead.
segments.cn: 如果他们抓住我，我就死了。

segments.en: So he's saying either I run free or I die.
segments.cn: 所以他说，要么我自由，要么我死。

segments.en: So to take someone alive is basically that.
segments.cn: 所以活抓某人基本上就是这个意思。

segments.en: He's saying they'll never catch me.
segments.cn: 他在说他们永远不会抓住我。

segments.en: So that's all the phrases we have for today.
segments.cn: 所以今天我们有的短语就到这里。

segments.en: Why don't we listen to this dialogue for the last time and we'll be back.
segments.cn: 我们再听一遍这个对话，然后再回来。

segments.en: I'm ready for my driving lesson.
segments.cn: 我准备好上我的驾驶课了。

segments.en: First, let's go over things one more time.
Now, before you even think of starting the car, make sure your seat is at a comfortable position and you can grip the steering wheel firmly.
segments.cn: 在你考虑启动汽车之前，确保你的座椅处于舒适的位置，并且你能牢牢握住方向盘。

segments.en: Next, check your rear view mirrors to make sure you can see properly.
segments.cn: 接下来，检查后视镜，确保你能看清楚。

segments.en: We've been through this a million times.
segments.cn: 我们已经讲过一百万次了。

segments.en: Now gently step on the clutch and shift to first gear.
segments.cn: 现在轻轻踩下离合器，换到一档。

segments.en: Now accelerate gently and let go of the clutch as you do it.
segments.cn: 现在轻轻加速，同时放开离合器。

segments.en: Keep your eyes on the road.
We're coming up to a red light.
Oh, this is just like playing video games.
segments.cn: 哦，这就像玩电子游戏一样。

segments.en: So driving now, this is interesting because as you mentioned, a lot of people in America usually have automatic transmissions, whereas in Europe, maybe they have manual transmissions.
segments.cn: 所以现在开车，这很有趣，因为正如你提到的，美国很多人通常使用自动变速器，而在欧洲，可能他们使用手动变速器。

segments.en: Is there a reason for that?
Um, I'm not sure what the reason would be.
segments.cn: 嗯，我不太确定原因是什么。

segments.en: I think a lot of American car makers manufacture more automatic cars in general.
segments.cn: 我认为很多美国汽车制造商一般生产更多的自动汽车。

segments.en: Some people say that it's because people in America are less concerned with gas, but if you have a manual transmission, you can actually conserve a bit of gas.
segments.cn: 有些人说这是因为美国人对油价不太关心，但如果你有手动变速器，实际上可以节省一些油。

segments.en: And so because gas prices in Europe are higher, generally, more people are interested in having manual transmissions.
segments.cn: 所以因为欧洲的油价普遍较高，更多人对手动变速器感兴趣。

segments.en: Also, I remember when I was younger, my dad always bought cars that had a manual transmission because he said that if ever they break down, it's much easier and cheaper to fix in a car that has a manual transmission than it is to fix an automatic one.
segments.cn: 此外，我记得我年轻时，我爸爸总是买手动变速器的车，因为他说如果车坏了，修理手动变速器的车比修理自动变速器的车要容易和便宜得多。

segments.en: Well, I personally think that it's better to learn how to drive on a manual transmission car because you can drive any car afterwards, but if you learn an automatic, you'll never know how to drive a manual.
segments.cn: 嗯，我个人认为学习如何驾驶手动变速器的车更好，因为之后你可以驾驶任何车，但如果你只学自动的，你就永远不会知道如何驾驶手动的。

segments.en: There was also a case on television recently about a small child that, actually the dialogue is based on it, is he took his dad's car and he was like seven years old and he was driving and was being chased by the police.
segments.cn: 最近电视上还有一个案例，关于一个小孩，实际上这个对话就是基于这个，他开了他爸爸的车，只有七岁，正在开车，还被警察追。

segments.en: And then he pulled into his house and got out of the car and ran into the house.
segments.cn: 然后他开进了家里，跳下车跑进了屋里。

segments.en: So obviously he was an underage driver, but he didn't get into much trouble, but it was interesting because he drove very, very well.
segments.cn: 所以显然他是未成年驾驶，但他没有惹上太多麻烦，但有趣的是他开得非常好。

segments.en: And basically almost learned it by game simulators, by video games on how you drive on a video game.
segments.cn: 他基本上是通过游戏模拟器，电子游戏学习如何开车的。

segments.en: So if you have any questions, any comments, or any other suggestions for lessons, please come to our website EnglishPod.com and we'll see you guys there.
segments.cn: 如果你有任何问题、评论或其他课程建议，请访问我们的网站 EnglishPod.com，我们在那里见。
